{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2985224,"name":"vargoose84","username":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-05T04:48:29.900Z","cooked":"

Hey all,

Unlike the other forms of drivetrains that 3630 has programmed, swerve seemed to be quite the bear with respect to consistently and effectively coding it, and teaching it to our next generation programmers.

As a result, we have put together a mini-bot (18" by 18") equipped with SDS MK3s powered by Falcon 500s fitted with a navx gyro and created some template code to help us in our future swerve endeavors. The code was a conglomeration, restructuring, and simplification of our 2020 and 2021 years The idea behind the code was to set us up for the least amount of head-bonking, wall-denting, robot-destroying troubleshooting, because let’s face it, there is plenty of that to go around. And also will be a good starting point to teach any of our newbie coders the structure and language of robot code. Here are some key points/features for our code:

  • Ideally, you only have to touch the Constants.java and update it with the correct IDs, orientation, offsets and initial uncharacterized gains
  • PID gains are run on-board the falcon 500s to increase update rate and limit CAN Utilization
  • Code builds upon the SwerveBot and trajectory examples from WPILib
  • Code is made to run with the now outdated frc-characterization for when the time comes to fine-tune feedforwards of the robot drive motors
  • It seemed that one of the swerve modules was “built-different” causing the robot to unintentionally rotate, so the code holds the robot heading until an “intentional” heading change is fed to the swerve drive
  • Code integrates a much easier shuffleboard logging system. Thanks @Oblarg! It’s so easy to build out a shuffleboard tab with this tool (see shuffleboard screenshot below) !
  • Code also integrates with Path Planner (I had to “boot-strap” it into the code until we get to update to WPILib 2022, thanks @mjansen4857 for the easy-to-use path planning

image1249×937 210 KB

Disclaimer: I took OOP Java in college and never used it until FIRST Robotics. So any CONSTRUCTIVE criticism on style and structure is always welcome ! I have a lot to learn!

Thanks for sharing! A couple questions (I also worked on code for a fall swerve, and just got it working!) My interpretations of the code might be wrong, feel free to correct if so:

  • Is there a reason you didn’t use feedforward control on the angle motors (in combination with PID) in addition to the drive motors?
  • Did you get to test PID onboard the controller vs PID onboard the RIO? How different were they?
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T02:00:48.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":78.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":398713,"topic_slug":"3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36775,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release/398713/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2985281,"name":"vargoose84","username":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-05T06:35:17.216Z","cooked":"

We had ‘noodled’ whether or not to do it. Due to the time-constraints, and the freakishly fast response using the PID onboard controller, we felt we got to the “good enough” place.

I think the reason for the improvement in snappiness of the steering motors, is because we’re running the loop every 1 ms rather than every 20ms.

Have you implemented characterization on the turn motors? How did it turn out?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2022-01-05T06:35:17.216Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":92.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":398713,"topic_slug":"3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":36775,"username":"merelephant","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/merelephant/{size}/139917_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release/398713/5","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2985284,"name":"","username":"merelephant","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/merelephant/{size}/139917_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-05T06:40:06.127Z","cooked":"

We used feedforward on the turning motors, but also onboard-RIO (profiled) pid loops. It works pretty well, but it definitely has room for optimization, and I think the first thing I’m going to try after kickoff is to put the PID controllers on the Falcons and use the arbitrary feedforward option to feed in the WPILib feedforward.

keep me posted, I was wondering how to actually structurally do that since the onboard PIDs use “set(ControlMode.Position, desiredAngle)”

I love the code and the final performance! Amazing job! I will for sure use this as a reference the next time I mess with a Falcon swerve.

I will echo what someone asked above about rotation PID constants. Looks like you’re only using raw kP control right now - adding the onboard kF and some kD will help you snap to an angle easier. kI can also help ease out the final bit of error, which might be helpful during motion profiling.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2022-01-05T06:53:39.782Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":74.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":398713,"topic_slug":"3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release/398713/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2985287,"name":"","username":"merelephant","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/merelephant/{size}/139917_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-05T07:16:19.064Z","cooked":"

Will do! To add feedforward, it looks like the CTRE API has a way to set an arbitrary percent output along with PID: Arbitrary Feedforward

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T05:33:05.816Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":83.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":398713,"topic_slug":"3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/2/4/24db9a41b2d4f088023a6b15b230ac642d7251a4.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/3630-stampede-robotics-offseason-swerve-code-release/398713/10","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992412,"name":"","username":"merelephant","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/merelephant/{size}/139917_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-15T22:22:17.986Z","cooked":"

Checking back in after basically finishing our swerve code:

We ended up using Motion Magic and built in (CTRE) kF for the turning motors. This is sufficient and really snappy, a lot better than roboRIO based control.

For drive, we did use CTRE velocity control along with WPILIB feedforward. The set line of code should probably give a good idea of how we did it:

 m_driveMotor.set(ControlMode.Velocity, desiredSpeed/kDriveDistMetersPerPulse * 0.1, DemandType.ArbitraryFeedForward, m_driveFeedforward.calculate(desiredSpeed) / Constants.kNominalVoltage);

We also got paths working really well, yay! Once I finish commenting/tidying the code I’ll make a post with it.
